p: DENV is a major public health concern on a global scale with an estimated 400 million infections and 100 million clinical cases in 2010. Most of these patients will carry the disease asymptomatically. However, around 5% of infected individuals will progress to severe dengue, an illness characterized by plasma leakage leading to hypovolemic shock, hemorrhage, and potentially death. The case-fatality rate for individuals with severe dengue can be as high as 10% if untreated, or 0.1% with appropriate clinical management [ 4].
